gurmukhi: SsqR pHwr Anyk kry qb ]jMg juitE Apno dl lY sB ]
transliteration: Shastra Prahaar Anek Dare Tab|| Jan Joutio Apno Dal Lai Sabh||
translation: Taking his other forces with him, he struck blows in many ways;

gurmukhi: bwj auTy qh kot ngwry ]ru`J igry rx ju`J inhwry ]377]
transliteration: Baaj Outhe Tah Kot Nagdare|| Rujjh Gire Ran Jujjh Nihdare||377||
translation: Many trumpets sounded there and the onlookers of war, also fell down in fear.377.

gurmukhi: SsqR AsqR lY skop bIr boil kY sBY ]kop Ep dY hTI su Dwie kY pry sBY ]
transliteration: Shastra Astra Lai Sakop Beer Bol(i) Kai Sabhai|| Kop Op Dai Hathisu Dhaae Kai Dare Sabhai||
translation: All the warriors in their fury, took their arms and weapons in their hands, moved forward with persistence and shouting loudly fell upon the opponents;

gurmukhi: kwn ky pRmwn bwn qwn qwn qor hI ]su JUJ JUJ kY prY n nYk muK morhI ]378]
transliteration: Kaan Ke Pramaan Baan Taan Taan Tor Hee|| Su Jhoojh Jhoojh Kai Darai Na Naik Moukh Mor-hi||378||
translation: The pulled their bows upto their ears and discharged their arrows and without moving backward even slightly they fought and fell.378.

gurmukhi: bwn pwn ly sBY skRu`D sUrmw cly ]bIn bIn jy ley pRbIn bIrhw Bly ]
transliteration: Baan Paan Le Sabhai Sakruddh Soormaa Chale|| Been Been Je Lae Prabeen Beer-haa Bhale||
translation: Taking angrily there bows an arrows in there hand they moved and the worriers were killed silectivly;

gurmukhi: SMk Cor kY iBrY inSMk Gwie fwrhI ]su AMg BMg huie igrYN n jMg qy pDwrhI ]379]
transliteration: Shank Chhodh Kai Bhidai Nishank Ghaae Daar-hee|| Su An Bhan Hue Girain Na Jan Te Padhaar-hee||379||
translation: They were all fearlessly inflicting wounds and their limbs are falling down, but still they did not run away from the battlefield.379.

gurmukhi: qwn sr Awn Ar mwn kr CorhIN ]AYn sr cYn kr qYn kr jorhIN ]
transliteration: Taan Sar Aan Ar Maan Kar Chhodh-heen|| Ain Sar Chain Kar Tain Kar Jor-heen||
translation: By pulling their bows, the warriors are proudly discharging their arrows and are uniting arrows with arrows discharging swiftly the later arrows;

gurmukhi: Gwv kr cwv kr Awn kr lwghIN ]Cwif rix Kwie biRx bIr br BwghIN ]380]
transliteration: Ghaav Kar Chaav Kar Aan Kar Laag-heen||chhaad(i) Ran(i) Khaae Brin Beer Bhaag-heen||380||
translation: They are striking blows with zeal and the great fighters also having been wounded are running away.380.

gurmukhi: kRoD kr boD hr soD Ar DwvhIN ]joD br kRoD Dr ibroD sr lwvhIN ]
transliteration: Krodh Kar Bodh Har Sodh Ar Dhaav- Heen|| Jodh Bar Krodh Dhar Birodh Sar Laav- Heen||
translation: The Lord (Kalki) is moving forward, killing the enemies angrily and consciously and is striking his arrows on the opponents;

gurmukhi: AMg Bt BMg huAY jMg iqh iB`ghIN ]sMg ibn rMg rx sRoxq n iB`ghIN ]381]
transliteration: An Bhat Bhan Jan Tih Digg- Heen|| San Bin Ran Ran Daronat Na Bhigg-heen||381||
translation: The warriors with chopped limbs are falling down in the battlefield and all their blood is oozing out from their bodies.381.

gurmukhi: Dwie Bit Awie irs Kwie As JwrhIN ]Sor kr jor sr qor Ar fwrhIN ]
transliteration: Dhaae Bhattee Aae Ris Khaae As Jhaar- Heen|| Shor Kar Jor Sar Tor Ar Daar- Heen||
translation: The warriors come in rage, strike the swords and are killing the enemies while shouting;

gurmukhi: pRwn qj pY n Bij BUm rn soBhIN ]pyK Cb dyK duq nwr sur loBhIN ]382]
transliteration: Praan Taj Pain A Bhaj(i) Bhoom Ran Sobh- Heen|| Pikh Chhab Delj Dit Maar Sur Lobh- Heen||382||
translation: They breath their last, but do not abandon the battlefield and seem splendid in this way; the women of gods are getting allured on seeing their beauty.382.
